text: Beatrice Deer, Montreal 2014-08-02 Beatrice Deer is a Canadian Inuk singer from Quaqtaq, Quebec. She released her debut album, Just Bea, in 2005, and won a Canadian Aboriginal Music Award for Best Inuit/Cultural Album. In 2010, she released her self-titled album, Beatrice Deer, and later that same year, she released a Christmas album, An Arctic Christmas. ==Biography== Deer is of Inuk descent and was born in Quaqtaq. She is the cousin of Jaaji of the band Twin Flames."Nunavik’s Jaaji Uppik finds his voice". Nunatsiaq News, March 31, 2014. Beatrice Deer performs throughout the north with her band. ==Discography== *Just Bea (2005) *Beatrice Deer (2010) * Fox (2015) * My All To You (2018) ==References== Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Inuit musicians Category:Canadian female singers Category:Canadian Inuit women Category:Musicians from Quebec Category:People from Nunavik Category:Inuit from Quebec Category:Canadian Folk Music Award winners Category:21st-century Canadian singers Category:21st- century Canadian women singers
title: Beatrice Deer
